I would go back to this place time and again if available.
Mary Ellen is a fantastic host. The house was sparkling clean there were nice outdoor touches and it was just as described. The communication was terrific and the setting is beautiful.
Mary was a wonderful host. She was quick with communication and flexible with accommodating my schedule. If you’re looking for a nice, restful getaway, Mary’s cottage is the place for you!

Mary Ellen was always prompt in responding to my questions as we planned our visit. The cottage was clean, furnished sweetly and home-y. If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing retreat, this is your place!
Very lovely couple! Amazing place to get away and relax at!!
A little more camping and bathroom was kind of a hike.

I stayed in the renovated chicken coop! the studio apartment like feel was very cozy and comfy. I personally didn't mind sharing a community bathhouse that wasn't attached to the stay but that's just me. the bathhouse was nicely furnished and felt like a mini hotel lol. The plot of land this place is on is gorgeous, wide open horizons for the sunset. They let me light a fire in the pit, I sat under the full moon and played guitar, dreams do come true lol. just stayed for one night, passing thru coming home from a roadtrip, and honestly am very glad I choose this place over a local hotel. it was fun, exciting, peaceful, rejuvenated the soul, and left me ready for my drive the next day. this air bnb left me with cool memories to finish off my roadtrip! Definitely staying here again someday!

If you’re looking for something out of the ordinary, a stay in a charmingly unique converted chicken coop is it. Friends asked “where did you find this place” and I’ve recommended it, planning to write a short piece of a newspaper travel piece about unique places for a weekend-getaway. Inside and out, we loved the kitschy decor, the art, and the beauty of the property and countryside. Thank you to Kelley, for her personal greeting on site and for inviting us to explore the outdoor property. Loved the sunset view from the corn crib.
We were only able to stay a short time, but would definitely come back! they thought of everything. The place was cozy and beautiful and the host was very helpful.
I really liked the chicken coop it was cute and the host was very friendly and greeted me when I arrived . very comfortable bed . was warm for how cold it was outside
Thank you
Super sweet host, loved the place, it was a little chilly but with all the extra blankets they had available we were just fine. Thanks for having us!
Loved the ambience and quiet!

My daughter and I were moving her from Seattle to Cincinnati and the Chicken Coop was a great overnight stay. They were understanding when we got in after dark, were quick to recommend restaurants on our way in, and we got such a great nights sleep in the very comfortable beds! Everything was as expected and was well represented in the posting and pictures. Since we got in late we didn't see the cool gate and fence on our way in but stopped to take pictures on our way out...it's made of bicycles and parts! Just another representation of their eclectic, whimsical stay :)
Cute little home on a bigger property. The converted chicken coop is a cleaver idea. Host was responsive and reached out to ensure check in was ok.

Our stay at BTR was amazing! Kelly was so kind and welcoming, giving us all the recommendations. We loved the coop! It rained on our stay, and the noise on the tin roof put us right sleep. Recommend this place to anyone looking!
The place is so cute. We booked super late at night and they responded back almost immediately saying it was available. We had a great stay! I highly recommend it.
Kelley’s place was a wonderful little taste of country living! I would definitely stay every time I am in the area!
very nice place to stay a few days, absolutely recommend it!
Annie says it was a cute and pleasant place. We enjoyed staying overnight and walking around. And we talked to the host and she was really nice. We would stay there again.

Absolutely loved our stay! The chicken coop was quirky and fun! Kelley was an amazing host and warmly invited us onto her beautiful property. Even though we booked this place to spend the night on our cross country trip, there was so many fun things to do. There were swings, a bonfire pit, a blackstone grill to cook on, and a fun cat! Our group loved the stay and it was a night to remember on our trip

The Chicken Coop, is an amazing little stay! My best friend and I stayed here for a girls weekend. It is small, but it was perfect for us! We brought our dogs and they loved the property. We spent an entire evening in the swings just talking. It is a peaceful place! I highly recommend staying here for a relaxing and peaceful time.
Fun place. Very unique. Beautiful area. The hosts have really done a great job in making it a warm, friendly, fun place.
Cozy

Great location. Very dog friendly. Close to the river, Newcastle Bridge, Spirit Mound and the hidden gem that is Vermillion, SD. Place has a ton of charm and fills a niche very similar to trailer/RV camping. Kelley was a friendly and responsive host. Mr. Moo their cat likes to come say Hi.
Perfect cozy unique place to lay your head. Beautiful farm property to walk around on, perfectly peaceful. Kelley is super helpful and friendly.

The Chicken Coop was a unique experience with beautiful views and lots of interesting amenities on site, like the corn crib swings and an outdoor basketball game and lit gazebo. We loved the whole aesthetic of Blue Tin Ranch!
it was a good place to stay
Beautiful surroundings. The chicken coop was exactly as described. Cool place for kids!

The chicken coop was such a charming and cozy stay! Hosts were friendly, communicative and welcoming. Everything was clean and ready for us. The swings around the campfire and grain wagon turned into basketball game we’re definitely a hit as well. No complaints at all and we will definitely be back!
Super cute place. The atmosphere was so majestic and tranquil. Hosts were so accommodating. Would defiantly stay here again!!
As advertised! The Midwest motif is great and the host was very helpful!
Loved the property, Tin roof on the coop was music to my ears when it rained

We would definitely recommend Kelly's place to anyone. We had very personal reasons that made their location ideal for us, but beyond that it provides easy access to Vermillion (USD), the Missouri River (a very special place), I-29, Whimps in beautiful downtown Burbank ;-) ....yet you're in a very sweet, tucked away spot that's very tastefully decorated with a very thoughtful host.
very accommodating, allows dogs, salt of the earth people

She was a lovely host and so thought to me and my family highlwy reccomend there property was so beautiful and they have putdoor activities like corn hole and basketball they also have a beatuful covered picinic area and lots of firepits for bonfire it would be a perfect family summer getaway!
This was our third stay at the location! We absolutely love it and they are wonderful host and go above and beyond
Really unique stay! Highly recommend.
Just a very unique and special place to stay. Host very accommodating. Beautiful setting and venue for special occasions. Thank you for the chance to enjoy your space

Super cute and unique, we enjoyed the swings for a few minutes before hitting the road again for another long day of travel. The no shower took us by surprise, but Noreen said they are getting one installed.
We loved “The Coop”. Will definitely come back!
The Coop was awesome! Bringing the dogs was a huge plus and the property was incredible. Great location and super cute place.
Cute cozy place to stay! Great views and fun property! Loved this location!

Super super super cute. Very accommodating and welcoming and the perfect little spot to stop on our way to school! Not sure if I missed this in the description when booking the place, but there are not any showers. Not really a problem, but just wish that I knew beforehand:) Would definitely recommend again!
loved it! the chicken coop (& the entire property) is so homey and cute. would recommend to anyone!
The coop was wonderful! Our hosts were incredibly accommodating, and their hospitality is amazing! Thanks for a wonderful stay!
Fun stay option. Instructions and maps were straight forward and very helpful.

The chicken coop was the perfect place for two old friends to meet in the middle. We enjoys sitting in the gazebo and watching the sun set and swinging in the corn crib while we told stories and caught up on each other's families. The only thing that would have made it better is if we could have stayed longer!
So cute! This is a great place to barbecue and enjoy the sunset. The beds were springy but comfortable and we had a lovely night. No shower for now!

Kelley’s coop was magical and very cozy. My kids and I stopped for the night on our way home from the black hills,SD. We all enjoyed the scenery and my kids though the coop was pretty neat. We would definitely stay here again.

Exactly what we were looking for and the host was ready to get us when we arrived and available for any questions. Beautiful grounds and the coop was exactly what we were looking for on our road trip. A+
Cute place and grounds!

The Chicken Coop was an enjoyable basic accommodation. (They refer to it as “glamping” in the welcome book) There is no shower at the time of writing this, but there are plans to add one, so check before you book! The kitchenette only has a microwave, so plan accordingly. Overall charming and quirky on a beautiful property.

We really enjoyed your beautiful property and I wish I could have a whole weekend to spend relaxing and just reading a book! Our only concern was a lack of shower/bathing option as that was not mentioned in the description, but thankfully wasn't a big deal for us for just one night! Who knows, maybe we will see you next year if my husband enjoys his week and the starting point is close to you again! Thank you, again!

Staying in a renovated chicken coop was pretty cool! Kelley has an amazing property with a lot of places to explore. The only downside was that there was no showers available. The listing says it has running water, but that’s only for a sink. If you want to shower, you’re going to have to drive up to the nearest truck stop.
Nice little place to stay if you enjoy nature and getting away from the city but not be too far when you do want to go to town!

First of all, this property was GORGEOUS. There was so much to explore and see, from the gazebo to the balcony of the reception hall to the corn crib swings and on! The twinkle lights strung throughout the grounds added a magical (and useful!) element to the stay.
To all people that will book in the future (which you definitely should)- remember that you will be staying in a refurbished chicken coop. There will be some spiders/flies/other random bugs in various nooks and crannies of the place. Do not come expecting your stay to be comparable to one at The Ritz. Embrace the eccentric and absolutely adorable stay for what it is. Outside, under the stars, in the fields, beneath the trees.
Kelley was a dream of a host. She was quick to respond and very informative. She provided cereal, milk, orange juice, and a gallon of water in the kitchen, as well as plastic cutlery, paper towels, garbage bags, etc. She also had chocolates and little snack pastries in the coop for us upon arrival.
I cannot stress how beautiful and expansive the grounds of this property are. I would highly recommend the chicken coop to anyone and everyone.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Chicken Coop! A true glamping experience with lots of fun things to explore around the property. The fact that it is pet-friendly was a big plus. Would recommend!

The Chicken Coop was a great addition for our large group. It is a unusual space, but quaint and comfortable. The beds are wonderful. No running water or bathrooms unless you go to another building on the property (as advertised).
Absolutely enchanting.

We stayed here and appreciated the whole ranch. I didn't mind not having wifi because I still had good signal. All the things I didn't think I needed was accessible and the washer and dryer made my life so much easier being on the road. Our group loved it here and we plan to be back in one years time! Wopida Tanka!! -Watob Omani
very cute and fun place to stay

Had a great stay in the coop! No running water/shower was complicated but the host was very kind and flexible and helped us out. We brought our lab puppy with us and he loved it there! Very dog friendly and lots of places to just hang out and relax. If you have dogs, beware of ticks! Coop was cute and eclectic, we loved it! The milk and cereal were a treat in the mornings, AC was nice and cold.
Blue Tin Ranch and the Chicken Coop were perfect! The Chicken Coop was comfortable and cozy - and Kelley was a great host. We loved the property! Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable.
This was a unique stay for the both of us. We liked the way it was set up. Clean and neat. If you don’t want the same old thing this is the place to stay.
I had a lovely stay with my dog. The property is beautiful. Kelley was a wonderful host. I definitely would come back.

Noreen is so incredibly kind and accommodating. We arrived pretty late into the evening on our check-in day, and she took the time to show us around, helping us feel safe and comfortable on the ranch. We stayed in the chicken coop, which was cozy and inviting after a long drive. The sinks and toilets are a short walk across their driveway (as stated on the listing), but this was a non-issue for us since the weather was very warm while we stayed and their light sensors turned on whenever we needed to head that direction at night. Although this was essentially glamping, there are plenty of outlets for lighting and charging phones/electronics if needed. We watched movies, relaxed, and were able to make cereal for breakfast (provided by Noreen). We even asked for extra fans to stay cooler at night. There is a window AC unit that helped a ton, but we're just not used to the humidity we experienced! Noreen took care of that and any other request we reached out for. My kids absolutely loved the ranch, chicken coop, and yard games... calling it their favorite part of our trip! The ranch location is just a short drive to Vermillion if you happen to be headed to USD like we were. Also, if you're lucky to stay on the property, you might get to say hello to Noreen's sweet pets Freckles and Moo. Thank you again for the memories, we hope to return soon!
Such a beautiful location and stay!! If I ever pass through the area again, will for sure stay here.
Kelley was super friendly and the chicken coop and exterior spaces were all really cute! Such a great find and highly recommend! Made the perfect pit stop along our road trip to CO from MN!
We had such an amazing time! It was clean, cute and cozy! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a fun little getaway!
Unique spot and very cute.

we really appreciate the hospitality, made us feel like home. We were a little bummed out because showers were not available upon check in and bathrooms were located outside in a separate building. Otherwise beautiful experience. The kids loved the unique experience and adventure we were able to have on her beautiful property.

Loved my stay here. The hosts were very friendly and easy to communicate with, greeted me on arrival and let me know where everything was. The coop was as pictured and a lovely place to stay. The bathroom facilities are spacious and plenty. I did not miss having running water in the coop. The provided amenities were a nice touch, too. Note that the second bed in the coop is an air mattress on a frame. The first bed was very comfortable and easy to sleep on, medium firmness.
The property has some lovely shared spaces and would be great to hang out in. The hosts were also welcoming to my dog, which I very much appreciated!

Kelly's Farm is a fantastic and serene place. It is right off the road so easy to access.
The farm itself is very big and therefore lot of open places to explore. Kelly has decorated a section of the farm very well, sitting in that Gazebo with shade over you and the birds chirping around you is very peaceful.
We stayed in the Chicken Coop, and it is literally that, a remodeled coop.
Therefore, the cleanliness takes a hit inside the room. The blankets/throws have lot of dust in it, the bed/mattress too is not in the greatest condition.
Also, given that the restroom is a short walk away from the coop, for me to say this is good value the per night price needs to further drop a little bit to say $35-$40.
But in the mornings one will realize how beautiful the place is, we loved the place apart from a few minor issues mentioned above.
Great stay! Very peaceful, lots of unique outdoor spaces.
Nice quiet getaway! Well restored older building with tin siding and however no running water in the chicken Koop. But restrooms are available nearby. Unique experience!!
I enjoyed my stay. Lots of birds and away from the city noises.

Blue Tin Ranch was fantastic! There are so many extra touches in the lodgings; cute decorations, clean and very spacious. Lots of fun farm games and things to see and do. I plan to stay longer next time and to bring my family! Hostesses were super nice!
Beautiful property and a sweet place to stay!

Wonderful place with lots to see! You can definitely tell they have put a ton of heart and effort into making this a fun and enjoyable place to stay, any questions we had were answered so fast! We will definitely be back!

It was a fun experience staying in the chicken coop - they had the heater going before I came so it wasn't too cold and they provided extra blankets. There were a lot of nice little touches included and the entire grounds (Blue Tin Ranch) was beautiful and relaxing. The host was super accommodating and I would definitely stay here again. It is a chicken coop, so go into to it with the right level of expectation and you will enjoy your stay. Definitely take the time to explore the place.
There is no running water. The space is not insulated and has only a small space heater. The farm is beautiful and well maintained. I booked in Oct. It was too cold to pay $90 a night.
Beautifully and artfully decorated on a secluded and relaxing lot. Lovely place. Could be the perfect retreat.
Awesome stay!! Clean, safe, and adorable.
Kelley has a wonderful gift for hospitality. I felt so comfortable and peaceful in the renovated chicken coop/glamping hut, I didn’t want to leave!
LOVED IT. I was only able to stay one night because that’s all that was available, there’s a reason they’re always booked. Such a beautiful property. Would love to return
Beautiful place !! Friendly hosts and at home vibes 😊 enjoyed the gazebo and other activities they had going on! Would stay there again for sure
Such a great experience! Communication was excellent and they were so inviting! Beautiful views of the sunset and lots to do! Highly recommend!
Recommend! Loved staying here, it’s beautiful and family makes you feel like you’re home! Very safe and organized.
the house is very accommodating of my last minute reservation

We enjoyed our stay at Valiant. The room was very clean, quiet, comfortable, and spacious. The view was great. It was easy to come and go without feeling like we were inconveniencing anyone. Friendly host. Overall a very welcoming experience!

This BnB was wonderful!! The hosts were wonderful, the venue was wonderful, it was all just WONDERFUL!!
In the evening there were cookies left in the kitchen for us and they were wonderful!
I very much enjoyed the complimentary wine and spirits tasting. I brought home the rhubarb wine. The Lion’s Paw ale did not last when it got home. My boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed it so next time you see me, it will be with my boo not my son. I look forward to experiencing one of the other themed rooms!
P.S. Breakfast the next morning was WONDERFUL! The bacon was perfect and I loved the seasoning on the potatoes!
This place was great! Beautiful room and quiet stay. Cold winter night, otherwise we would have enjoyed the scenery from the back deck.
Beautiful room, wonderful wine and the staff is amazing. Took the time to sit and talk with us and made recommendations. The breakfast was amazing. We would definitely come again. Thank you!

A delightful winery, has a variety of wines to try as well as whiskey and rum. The room was clean as was the tasting/ dining area. It was quiet and peaceful and was an enjoyable stay. will visit again.
Beautiful place to stay. The breakfast is wonderful. Can’t wait to come back.
One of our favorite places to stay. Sitting on the back deck watching the full moon come up in the east as a thunderstorm rolled across the plains in the west was the best.
This is a real bed and breakfast - charming, quality furnishings and accessories, peaceful, excellent bed and delicious breakfast. Pleasant balcony patio. Excellent service.
The University room is spacious and comfortable. The view from the third floor balcony, not far from the room, is gorgeous. We enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting and delicious breakfast.
As a USD grad and lover of all things Vermillion, it's hard to beat the morning views on the patio overlooking the Vermillion and Missouri rivers. Great hospitality, food, and rooms.

The place is clean and the breakfast is wonderful. The host is so kind.
The walls seem to be thin and we could hear a lot of others conversations in the hallway and wondered if other people could hear us. The bathroom did not have any conditioner so bring that if you need it.
Friendly staff, nice view toward river, good wines, and a comfortable stay! The breakfasts were great and even got to chat with a local artist and the owner! Win-win! 👍🏼

We stayed here to celebrate New Years and had a wonderful time. Very clean. Excellent communication with hosts. The wine tasting was great and there were many fun items in the gift shop as well. Breakfast was delicious - felt like we were staying at a lodge! Highly recommend this wonderful winter retreat.

Everything about our stay the weekend of Oct. 22-24 was excellent. Friendly staff, great breakfast, clean room, etc. The only drawback was the low water pressure for the shower, but otherwise we'd definitely stay there again...and next time try to experience more of the vineyard and the wine tastings. Thanks for a wonderful weekend!
This was a wonderful overnight stay. We were made to feel so welcome. Beautiful view, comfortable room, very relaxing. Fun wine flight and delicious breakfast Great experience
Great host and wonderful views!
Very Nice.

Comfortable room with everything you need. Beautiful setting makes for great balcony hangs in the evening. The food is great and the hospitality is second to none. The vineyard is close to the Missouri River and we got out for some light hikes around the area each day. Lots of great lunch and dinner choices in town and close to shopping in Sioux City.

This place deserves all the accolades. We missed the wine and whiskey tasting days on the days we were there, but were invited to arrange a private tasting! The staff are amazing: we were cooked wonderful breakfasts; everything was clean and well organized; and the staff who worked there were really helpful and friendly. The shared kitchen has all you need to heat up and serve, but not really cook.
And oh, the deck! Get there early enough to enjoy sitting on the deck with a pair of binoculars. American goldfinches everywhere.
nice and cozy place
Wine-tasting on the scenic balcony is an awesome experience!
Great value
Wonderful place! Great room and the winery was also wonderful. The winery is worth a trip alone. We will definitely be back soon!
Great place. They even modified our meals to Keto. Best place in Vermillion.
Such a great experience! I don't believe the pictures even do the place justice. I went to just have a little get away and it exceeded my expectations!
Great place, breakfast was awesome!
This was a perfect choice for our visit to USD. The views from the balcony are amazing. The breakfast is fantastic. Room was spacious and clean.

The Vineyards worked out perfectly for a stay to visit my Dad, who lives in SD now. The breakfast was fabulous, room very clean, and a beautiful area. There was a blizzard during one day of our stay and Sherry even offered personal accommodations to help us out. Will book again!

Lovely getaway near Sioux City. It was easy to check in. Great hospitality with free wine tasting and amazing cookies waiting in our room. Breakfast by the fireplace in the morning was so nice. We felt well taken care of and at a bargain price. Thank you for refreshing us!

It’s an awesome inn. Our beds were very comfortable, but bring your pillows. The suite is roomy, with a nice en suite bathroom and everything is spotlessly clean. Best for last, breakfast is varied and wonderful!!
Good location and spacious room.
A spacious, clean, comfortable room. Quiet, too. And a complimentary wine tasting. Recommended.
Vermillion is a fun place to visit and the Valiant a great place to stay.
Cozy getaway with a great view! Communication with the host was excellent, very responsive. Breakfast is included and is amazing 😃.
Great breakfast!! Great scenery!! Very quiet and peaceful! We enjoyed our stay. Will come again!!!
Very friendly staff, fun wine tasting. So pretty

We stayed only one night and I wish we could have stayed for a week. It was the best nights rest I’ve had in a very long time! Everything was perfect, and the hostess created a dairy free breakfast just to accommodate my daughter. So grateful!
clean, great hospitality, accommodating, friendly, beautiful views,
Valiant was an amazing host! The space was very clean, the staff helpful and friendly, the wine is amazing, and the breakfast was perfect! I would love to stay again if in the area.

Loved the location, the accomodations were very comfortable; decor like you would expect in a winery but all the fixtures looked brand-new; breakfast was superb - one of the best I've ever had. The tasting room was closed but I still was able to buy a few bottles. Outstanding
A very pleasant and safe place to stay. Would prioritize a stay here in the future.
Great place to stay! Breakfast was excellent and the location was beautiful and convenient!

Sherry and Adriane helped me immensely as a person who has never been to South Dakota. I stayed during July 4th weekend when most restaurants were closed, and Sherry and Adriane went out of their way to help me get some food in Vermillion. Their hospitality was outstanding and the food was excellent for breakfast. I was pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the location and the historical significance of the vineyard and neighboring landmarks. Some of those landmarks were even part of the Lewis and Clark trail. Highly recommended, and if I am ever in Vermillion I wouldnt hesitate to stay again.
Great place for a quiet weekend away!
We enjoyed our stay here. Accommodating staff and comfy beds! Very charming place to stay and the wine we sampled was very good.
Cute older house, perfect for what we needed
This was an absolute great find!! It was blocks from walking anywhere in Vermillion. Would stay here again

Fun, quirky home! After long hours of working on a project for the University, it was nice to come back to this little haven. My assistant and I are vintage nerds, so this place was perfect! Amberly was prompt in replying to our questions and checked in with us to make sure we had what we needed.
Lovely stay.
Charming house in a well kept neighborhood.
Daniel was very nice, and his home was comfortable and cozy we will definitely book again.
Great to stay there, very nice place!
Great stay! Definitely make sure to stay here if you are in the area!
The place was so cute and it ended up to be right in the neighborhood where we needed to be!
Charming house in a charming neighborhood! We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this place!
Lovely folks, great space would 💯 stay again. lock was a bit of a hassle, would recommend updating, but host was super responsive and helpful.
Great place!
Quick communication and nice older house close to where we needed to be.

It was a very nice property! Very clean, comfortable beds, fully stocked, and we loved it! The host was amazing and accommodating. It was beautiful and everything was perfect. We'd definitely stay again.

It could not have been more perfect. Beautiful home ..so peaceful and filled with good energy.
It had everything we needed. We would love to have to stay again when we come back.
Our stay was great for the weekend. It was very convenient for walking places. We would stay there again.
I absolutely loved my stay here! The house was prefect…so cozy and comfortable; the hosts were great, too! I can’t wait to stay again on my next trip to Vermillion.
fabulous. had everything needed, especially in lichen and for families

Cozy, quaint and eclectic architectural home. Thoughtful consideration of amenities… French press and lovely selection of teas was so thoughtful, and such a fun collection of books… and a piano!! :)
Location is perfect!! We parked and walked to everything the entirety of our stay. So close to great coffee, eats, local businesses and USD.
Check-in was seamless and instructions for everything were complete and easy to follow!!
Made our business trip, such an unanticipated treat!!!
Will not hesitate to book again with Daniel, when we are in the area!!
Very cool place and loved the butterflies in the backyard very relaxing
Quirky place to stay. Location was great for USD.
Great location and easy to get to places in town. Thanks for the stay.

We love Airbnb’s for the room, comfort, and privacy. This one definitely has privacy and comfort! The yards are full of over grown plants - in a good way. They shelter the property so you feel like you are in an oasis. Private back sitting area, small but private. The front porch was the place to hang outside. The bathroom is small and the only access is through two of the bedrooms but that did not pose an issue for our family of 4.
Hosts were SUPER responsive! Check in was a breeze. We had everything we needed at the house for the week.
When we checked in the AC was on (was a hot humid day so we were very thankful!) and they left the lights on for us 😊
We figured only one TV (living room) so had packed another for one of the kids Xbox. But with all the trips we took - Sioux City and Sioux Falls, we were only there in the evenings.
Which to another point - Verm is nicely centrally located to go for day trips to two large cities!
Beautiful and interesting home with everything you need.

A great house with tons of character. I appreciate having multiple places to sit, read, and work. The location is super convenient for walking pretty much anywhere in town. It is my favorite place to stay in Vermillion.
This is a lovely house and very comfortable. It has everything possible that you might need and is very conveniently located. We will definitely stay again.
Very lovely, well-kept older home! Comfortable stay.

It was a great location in Vermillion, near Prentis Park and Main Street. It’s a minutes walk to coffee shops and to campus! This home has a lovely aesthetic and is both comfortable and inviting. We loved our stay!
Daniel’s home was charming, comfortable and served our needs for a one night stay in vermillion while visiting family.
We enjoyed our stay there. Had nice touches with supplies that made it welcoming. Loved the bird watching that the garden encouraged.
Super nice place, thanks for hosting us!
This house was perfect for us to stay near campus for a three day long event! I highly recommend this location!

Beautiful house with many great details. Clean and safe neighborhood. The host is thoughtful to provides little things like packaged breakfast and zip bags. The only issue I had was curtains. They are decorative and pretty but it doesn’t block the light from outside. Other than that, it was a very nice stay.

Amberly and Josh went above and beyond to help us out and make sure we were provided for. The house was perfectly situated for us in the town, University and nearby Prentis Park. It was homey and comfortable. We would stay there again when in the area.

This is great spot to stay for any visit to Vermillion. The decor was interesting, there were plenty of dishes, spices and cooking necessities in the kitchen, great selection of books to read, a desk for work, a large gathering table, and the privacy of 3 sleeping areas. It has one of Vermillion's beautiful iconic town lamp posts out front, a morning porch to sit on for coffee, Frnch Press and a very private back yard with flowers and plantings. Kitchen was clean, bathrooms were clean, and linens and big towels were just fine, a/c worked very well. This is a good examples of a family house being successfully turned into a very usable guest house. Hoping to come back. Loved the regional Sioux inspired art to enjoy and the fresh paint job throughout. The greenery in the back garden and off street parking gave us privacy and a few blooms to enjoy. Great for a family stay or couple's retreat with full kitchen, university event stay. They home is in a prime yet quiet spot.
Such a lovely and peaceful space! I’m so happy to have the chance to visit my family and stay in this beautiful home. Thank you!
Had a lovely stay at this eclectic home. It was very comfortable and it had everything we needed. We were not sure how to use the Roku, so couldn’t use the TV, but the Wi-Fi worked fine.

Bathroom situation was geared more for family style since the two bedrooms were attached with no other access than going through one or the other to enter the bathroom. Great place otherwise, quaint and comfortable!
Thank you again for great place.
So much character in this home. Great porch and garden area. Within walking distance of fun places. Very clean!!
Great stay would definitely recommend it. I would stay here again.
Very nice cozy house.

This is a very cute home that was perfect for our family of 6. My kids loved the bunk beds and the few kids toys and coloring that they had available. The place was very clean and had everything you could need. The gas fireplace was very cozy. Only downside I saw was that the only bathroom is in the middle of two of the bedrooms, so if anyone needed to use the bathroom from the 3rd bedroom they would have to enter someone else's bedroom to get there. We would definitely stay again! Much better for a family here than at a hotel!
This house is adorable and we loved the bohemian vibe!! The place was spotless, and had so many interesting books and great kids toys and art supplies.

Sometimes the line seems to blur between the enthusiasm a visit generates and the housing that allows all the generous features of the away-from-home adventure to meld, but I am very clear minded about the salient features of host Kea Sophie and Gabriel's Airbnb; Patricia and I thrived there and our experiences in Vermillion were greatly enhanced by virtue of staying in such a such a curiously warm and charming house nestled in a neighborhood that at once felt familiar and friendly. If one of your things is peace and quiet, I can only report that the loudest noise I heard during our week's stay was the sound of my head hitting the pillow on a very comfortable bed. Clean? Sure. Amply stocked. Yes. Convenience? On foot, two zigs and a zag get you to the bountiful yet quaint historic main street, and 30 cents worth of gas will take you to either the franchise strip or all things University of South Dakota, depending on your bent...and back. Easy access and communication? Of course. But these aspects seem to pale in comparison to the house's character. It is an old house that has been updated just enough to maintain the integrity and grace that comes with age. It has a generous lived-in feel and an assortment of curious furnishings, each iconic, enriching, from its own era with a story to tell. Reservations about our stay? None, save this...I suspect it will be increasingly difficult to book this marvelous mini mansion as time goes on.
